file_content.text: You may pass through the temple.
Ah. My spies tell me you found the Dark Path--and it seems you survived their fury.
Did you find Anyarah? Did you see my apprentice there?
Anyarah's not your apprentice. None of this is what you believe.
She's not who you claimed.
She is determined to remain with the Dark Path, then? How disappointing.
I found her--but she didn't make it back. The Dark Path got her.
Anyarah was killed.
I am disappointed. I thought you would serve me better... but perhaps Anyarah was already lost.
Sorry--I couldn't find her.
No.
Then you have failed me.
Still, you struck a blow at my rivals, and the Dark Path will not move against me soon.
You may leave with your life. Take this reward--a token in acknowledgment of your efforts--and go.
I still have questions for you, Lord Pharshol.
I want answers.
I wish it'd gone better.
Do not try my patience. Go from here now.
How worthless.
Ah. You have done well. Very well, in fact.
Anyarah returned to me, bearing news of what happened. You were wise to set her mind to rights and free her from the Dark Path.
Your apprentice--what's happened to her?
Where's Anyarah now?
She is safe, outside the reach of our enemies. You needn't think of her any longer.
Good of you to say.
I still have a lot of questions for you.
I need answers.
As you wish. But first, there is another matter.
I promised you a reward for your assistance--and I have riches to spare. Take what I have, and revel in it.
Now, unless there is anything else--I must marshal my forces against the Dark Path.
I want to know what's going on here.
Talk about the temple.
There is something strange happening. I didn't believe it until Anyarah's return, but you are right.
Tell me how you and the others got here.
Where'd you come from?
I came to Dromund Kaas with the colonists, of course. We built the temple in the jungle. And yet... there is something strange.
Something presses at my mind. I remember... life in a city beyond the temple walls. This city does not exist, but I remember it.
I remember being a simple man of tools and strength. Not Sith--a servant to the Sith. But these delusions pass.
That's who you really are--you come from Kaas City.
You're a construction worker.
Do other people in the temple experience these delusions?
Anyone else like you?
Yes. Such mirages drove Anyarah away. Now she is free of them--and we need discuss it no more.
Maybe you're going crazy.
You're insane.
You overstep your bounds. I know who I am. I am Lord Pharshol, builder of the temple.
I have answered your questions, and we are finished here. Begone!
I'm done.
Be wary of the temple's dangers, then. Beyond this room, I will not protect you.
Find my apprentice! Find her in the depths of the temple.
Enter and hear me. You musn't kneel; I would gain no satisfaction from it.
So you've finally found our hidden temple. It's long since time--the followers of the Dark Path battle my forces, and your cruelty is needed.
What are you talking about? Who are you?
Huh?
Fool. I am Pharshol, Dark Lord of the Sith--and you stand within my domain.
This temple isn't exactly hidden. There's a path from Kaas City.
"Hidden" temple?
Do you mock me? No one finds this temple, nor this planet, by accident--nor without my approval. For I am Lord Pharshol!
As you wish.
Good. Then we shall begin. I am the Dark Lord Pharshol.
I oversaw this temple's construction, and I have ruled the jungle ever since. Now you will serve me.
You look more like a workman than a Sith.
You don't seem a Dark Lord.
My robes and helm were won in battle against Lord Vacuus. My lightsaber burns with the light of a star! And you dare question me?
You're not making any sense. The Dark Temple was built centuries ago.
That's absurd.
You are confused. I remember clearing the jungle and laying each stone... and I am no immortal.
I obey.
Good. Then we understand one another.
Now do as I require, and the riches of the temple will be yours.
The teachings of the Dark Path lured my apprentice Anyarah away--but I will have her back. You will retrieve her from the temple depths.
I don't understand. What's the "Dark Path"?
Dark Path?
How can you not know? The other Dark Lords founded the path to lure away my students.
How can anyone survive in the temple?
How many people are in here?
Whatever do you mean? Many live within the temple--it is our only sanctuary on this abominable world.
If your apprentice betrayed you, she should die.
She should be killed.
If she refuses to come back, you may kill her. But she is valuable to me.
There's a struggle for power going on, then?
This is a competition?
Yes. It forces us all to become stronger.
You want me to infiltrate the Dark Path?
Should I get inside the group?
No. That is unnecessary.
Fight the bad guys, catch the girl. Got it.
The job's clear.
I do not know how my rivals reached my apprentice, but I know where she went. The Dark Path hides near here.
Kill the followers of the Dark Path. Fight your way to their altar, and Anyarah must confront you. Do this--or be punished by my power.
Yes, Lord Pharshol.
Understood.
I don't believe you have any power.
You're delusional.
Doubt no longer. Witness a demonstration of my strength!
Now you have seen the power of a Dark Lord of the Sith. Now we are finished.
Your might is... impressive.
I underestimated you.
If you won't tell me what I want to know, I'll discover the truth myself.
I'll learn what's going on.
When I get back, I want real answers.
We'll discuss this later.
Time to get to work, then.
All right.
It seems... I was wrong about you. I'll be on my way.
I was clearly mistaken.
You may be Sith--but something's very strange here.
This is all wrong.
Maybe.
Then we shall see what becomes of you.
The followers of the Dark Path are not far. Go, and I will await you.
Now is not our time to speak.
